comments.commentBody: It should not be possible to write an article like this and forget to remind readers of Trump's odd praise for his fellow dictator Putin.  Likewise that Manafort worked for the kleptocrat who ran Ukraine--a Putin puppet.  The supposedly innocent dots the media is connecting are not the only dots.

And thank the Dems for yet again, as is their wont, for not organizing at state and local levels.

We avoided a loud emotional woman and found a thoughtful, considered, serious, measured, reflective, well read, cool and emotionally controlled man to lead we the people.

Getting background information to build a platform and prepare for a transition is reasonable, as is building personal relationships for the future. Making promises about what your party will do if you win is "diplomacy" and violates the Logan act.

NYT - You followed the smoke.  Now find the fire.  Please be diligent and dogged in your journalistic duties.  America depends on you. There's not much riding on this - only the First Amendment and the future of the country.

Face it, he's the Manchurian Candidate--bought, sold, and delivered by the Soviet Union (with assistance by the gullible voters of Ohio, Michigan, and Pennsylvania) into the Oval Office.  He's Donald Trumpovich, the Czar of Putin's satellite bureaucracy.  Da!

@Mark:

Sen. McCain and Sen. Graham have integrity, and they do frame issues beyond the dictates of narrow political partisanship. That fact alone makes them stand out in a party full of sellouts, partisan hacks, ideological cranks and spineless sycophants -- ciphers devoid of it. This is why their lives are in danger.

Should they take a crucial leading role in forcing the Senate to investigate the Putin regime's involvement in Trump's election campaign they do it at no small risk to their lives and families. They risk of being neutralized on Putin's orders by his people here. Dying suddenly, in unclear or mysterious circumstances. Or shot during an "attempted robbery". Or "taken ill" after being poisoned. They will join hundreds of Putin's critics and political enemies killed anywhere his agents could reach them.

Russians living here openly or covertly, agents in Russia's FSB working with or without diplomatic cover, will arrange it or do it themselves.

Trump, of course, will deny that anything of the sort had occurred, insisting that no connection between it, himself and his Kremlin master exists.

Never forget for a moment that we are at war with Russia.

Given that Trump publicly requested that Russia back the US government to find and release more of Hillary's emails,how much of a stretch is it to assume he colluded in their hacking and influencing the election in his favour?

I think Comey needs to be investigated too given his suspicious conduct in announcing a further investigation into Hillary when she was aiming,despite that being against protocol,yet now won't co-operative with other Intel in their investigation of GOP?
It was a joke.  Everyone laughed.  Actually, a very funny one.  New York humor.
Tax returns, please.  How much did Trump borrow, and from whom?  What did Don,jr. mean when referencing Trump family business interests in Russia?

You're right that it's difficult to prove that the election was changed. If it was certain the election results would have been taken to court. If Trump is guilty of collusion it would be worse than that, but there's no evidence, ... yet.

The current problem is the constant lying about it all. Every statement made on the subject by the administration is turning out to be a lie. It's reasonable that people don't like to be lied to, and that they assume the worst.

Have just read about Trump's latest tweet...that C. Shumer met Putin years ago!  So what?  How is this anything like the Putin/Russia issue with Russian Diplomats who are part and parcel Putin's men...the ones who hacked the DNC.  The difference in case Mr. Trump reads my letter, is that as C Shumer has pointed out...his meeting was OPEN and for all the world to see.  The clandestine calls before they took office of Trump's choices for his staff are totally another ball of wax.  And there had better be an investigation of Sessions...I predict however that somehow the Republican Party will stonewall this.
Yes and the tweeter in-chief isn't even bright enough to figure out the pic was years old

Isn't the best antidote to rumour and denial the creation of a Special Counsel (independent Prosecutor) to looking the Russian file, the missing tax returns and the conflicts of interest? And why is this resisted? In its  absence it falls on the press to continue very active investigative journalism.

This is so bizarre. I often feel like I don't recognize my country right now.

I assume this is all temporary. Which might prove to be wrong.
Maybe not. Some or many could be pathological liars who lie as a matter of course regardless of the importance of the matter.

Live from Moscow West, it's...
SATURDAY MORNING LIES!

Now THERE'S good journalism!
MSNBC, the Russian diplomat/courier, the pawn, the double secret communiques, the sellout of the US....the, the, THE MANCHURIAN CANDIDATE!
And here I've missed it all along

I assume your comment is meant as a joke...otherwise it sounds like all those led so easily down the garden path by people from D. Trump down who loved the glow of "lock her up."  Well she is not locked up and so far Flynn has had to resign...Who is next?  When will the FBI be weighing in as they did about the email, by the way?  Right now they look as partisan and stupid as say Sean Spicer or Kelly Anne Conway who regularly justify the trashing of the truth.

Part 1.  From Sandra Hensley  Amy, you are a very special lady. And you remind me of my husband, (Bobby) that went to be with Jesus on October 8, 2001. We were married 2o3 year's. And on the day that I lost him all he worried about was me & our 2 children. He was the love of my life. And the day that I lost him was the hardest day of my life. Bobby pasted away 2 times before his final passing, and both times he brought back on life support. And both times he pulled out his life support and ask for me. And the doctors finally let me go see him. And when I got to him bed side he looked at me and said, we knew that this day would come and that I would have to leave you, but don't worry because I will never leave you I'll always be in your heart forever, and I need you to know that you are the best wife & mother any man could ever ask for, and I want you to promise me that when I'm gone that you will move on in life and find someone that makes you happy and live your life and be happy, I told him I could not promise him that and he said to me honey please promise me that you will move on and live your life and be happy, because your to young and to beautiful to live your life alone. So I told him I would try.

As a gay woman, I would even cross back over for a man like Jason.
You are a very lucky woman, and he is a very lucky man.
Few experience the years of love you two have.

It would be an honor and privilege to meet Jason...and to channel you for him so he never has to live a day without you...or you him...having lost my spouse I know too well the pain. I love you both...amazingly beautiful kind generous spirited beings. Grateful I was led to your story
I wish you more, too.

This won't get published, but if you could foresee just how quickly Jason reconnects, you might get quite angry. That's what men do - they reconnect - sometimes in stunningly short periods of time, and from what I've seen, they're not all that picky.   Take care of yourself and don't try to control what's going to happen after you're gone.

You're projecting, MD. You just inject "you might get quite angry! Don't try to control! Men aren't picky!"

From 'what you've seen', you are applying your own experiences onto Amy. You'll be most satisfied if Jason stumbles after Amy's death! Ha!

It's really wrong to insert doubt and self-judgement into someone's well-considered decisions. I'll bet you're a joy to converse with!

Governor Walker, our protests in Wisconsin was against the governmental overreach of your administration, taking away local control and the interests of the voters.  Your administration has continued to take away local control in the actions of you and the legislature since 2010.  You overrode the vote of the majority of voters in our county that wanted to retain stronger protection of our lakes and rivers, you overrode the majority vote for stronger public schools in our county, and you overrode the majority of voters that wanted stronger land use regulation in our county.   Your concern for state control rather than federal is in direct contradiction to what you are doing in your own state where the legislature and yourself  are overriding the wishes of the voters in the counties and towns.  Hypocrisy is the mildest term I could use to describe your own actions in your own state.

@Michael
Fremont

Why in the world do some people feel the need to get in the way of willing drug dealers and a willing addict?

This is such an amazing article. Thank you for saying these beautiful words. I was truly moved to tears. As someone who is only 19, I wonder about love quite a bit and your article really instilled the belief in me that it is out there.
Justin:  Poor you.  This was a very touching story, but obviously not for you.  Sad.
